thread.title: Gary Neville left celebratory voicemails on random Liverpool fan's phone after 2006 Champions League defeat | Metro News
thread.title_full: Gary Neville left celebratory voicemails on random Liverpool fan's phone after 2006 Champions League defeat | Metro News

author: Coral Barry For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Gary Neville left celebratory voicemails on random Liverpool fan's phone after 2006 Champions League defeat | Metro News
text:
Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 3:52 pm Gary Neville enjoyed a fiery relationship with Liverpool players and fans (Picture: Getty) 
Gary Neville left several voicemails taunting a random Liverpool fan after the Reds lost 2-1 to AC Milan in the 2007 Champions League final. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
The Liverpool supporter, Jay McKenna, happened upon the then Manchester United player’s phone number and rang Neville up to check it was him. 
Neville rang the Scouser back and a slagging match ensued between the United legend and the Liverpool fan. 
McKenna’s stick of choice was that he was on the way to the 2007 Champions League final and Djimi Traore had as many Champions League medals as he did. Great story from @JayMcKenna87 on this weeks 'Wildcards'. 
— THE ANFIELD WRAP (@TheAnfieldWrap) February 15, 2017 Liverpool lost the 2007 Champions League final to AC Milan (Picture: Getty) 
A few days later, with Liverpool having been beaten 2-1 in the final by Milan, McKenna woke up to two voicemails from Neville celebrating the Reds’ defeat. 
Neville then confirmed the story by sharing the clip from The Anfield Wrap podcast and urging United fans to give it a listen. I Enjoyed that!! Worth a listen United fans… haha.. https://t.co/7roJsxekR9
